sentences.text: Our Mission
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We exist to operate a world-class energy business that creates sustainable value for our four stakeholders  owners, customers, employees and the communities in which we operate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is our mission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entergy was named to the Dow Jones Sustainability North America Index in 2016, our 15th consecutive year to appear on the World or North America Index or both.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also achieved perfect scores of 100 in the focus areas of biodiversity, climate strategy and water-related risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entergy was named one of the nations Top 100 Corporate Citizens by Corporate Responsibility Magazine, ranking 4th in philanthropy and community support out of the largest 1,000 U.S. based companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 21, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Fellow Shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I hope you will join Entergys Board of Directors, executive management team and employees at our 2017 Annual Meeting of Shareholders in Little Rock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, we conduct our annual meeting in a location in our service territory to give us the opportunity to connect with shareholders we might not otherwise meet, showcase our operations, and celebrate our connections to the customers and communities we serve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I look forward to coming to Little Rock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The attached Notice of Annual Meeting of Shareholders and Proxy Statement will serve as your guide to the business to be conducted at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to conducting the official business of the meeting, I plan to share some highlights from 2016, which was a pivotal year for our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We delivered on our commitment to grow our core utility business, achieving exceptional earnings growth in our core utility business and making productive investments that are positioning us well to deliver steady, predictable growth in earnings from our utility business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also completed our plan to exit the merchant power business, including decisions to sell or shut down each of our remaining owned merchant nuclear power plants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I look forward to discussing 2016 results and the opportunities we see in front of us today, as we continue to execute on our business strategy with decisions and investments that will serve our customers and our shareholders well into the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also are continuing our commitment to provide you with information about the Company in a manner that is easy to access and understand.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Proxy Statement is a good example, providing a summary at the beginning that highlights our business and executive compensation programs using charts and other graphic depictions where we feel they may be helpful.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year we also have continued our efforts to eliminate redundancy and make the presentation of information more reader friendly.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Discussion and Analysis that begins on page 33 describes our executive compensation programs and shows how our executives compensation remains linked to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You will also find discussions of the qualifications of our director candidates and why we believe they are the right people to represent you starting on page 10.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote is important to us and our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to the meeting, I encourage you to sign and return your proxy card, or use telephone or Internet voting, so that your shares will be represented and voted at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions on how to vote are found beginning on page 89.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I hope to see you at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thank you for being a shareholder and for your support of Entergy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leo P. Denault Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is committed to sound and effective corporate governance practices and continuously monitors best practices and actively seeks input from our shareholders on these issues.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below are highlights of our key governance policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Changes Since 2016     Annual Meeting       After engagement with our shareholders, we adopted a proxy access right for our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We formalized an emergency succession plan to enable the Board to respond rapidly and effectively to an unplanned and unexpected vacancy in the office of the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate   Governance Best   Practices    Annual election of directors    Majority voting for directors    Resignation policy for directors who do not receive majority vote    Regular executive sessions of independent directors         Independent lead director with broad authority when role of Chairman and Chief Executive Officer are combined      Mandatory director retirement policy      Year-round shareholder outreach program      Robust director and executive stock ownership guidelines      No poison pill; Board policy requires shareholder approval for adoption         Disclosure of corporate political contributions and oversight of lobbying and political activity            Lead Director   Responsibilities       Presides at executive sessions of the independent directors and all meetings of the Board at which the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer is not present      Assists with director recruitment      Calls meetings of the independent directors      Reviews and advises on Board meeting agendas         Provides feedback from the Board to the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer following each executive session of independent directors and, together with the Chair of the Personnel Committee, provides the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer with an annual performance review
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sustainability and Corporate Social Responsibility
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sustainability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achieving our mission of creating sustainable value for all of our stakeholders is possible only through a balanced review of opportunities and risks to our business strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On an ongoing basis, we analyze material economic, environmental and social issues that impact our ability to create value for our stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entergy assesses the range of potentially relevant topics for our business and the relevance to our key stakeholders: owners, customers, employees and communities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engage in a variety of informal and formal communications with our key stakeholders and other important groups, and then use this stakeholder input from dialogue, surveys and other means to help prioritize the most material issues and ensure that our sustainability focus is on these most important areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4       2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Integrated Reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our integrated reporting reflects how we measure and manage our overall performance with a combination of financial, environmental, community and employee measures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More importantly, it reflects our central belief that the interests of all of our stakeholders are inextricably linked.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Social Responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entergys approach to social responsibility is grounded in the philosophy that Entergy can only be as successful as the communities we serve.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our communities, we are committed to creating value through economic development, philanthropy, volunteerism and advocacy, and by operating our business safely and in a socially and environmentally responsible way.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we demonstrated our social responsibility commitment through a wide variety of initiatives, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Grants totaling $2.2 million to 17 programs across our four-state region as part of a $5 million, 5-year workforce development program;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: More than 114,000 volunteer hours by our employees and retirees in support of community service projects and activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder Outreach
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year we conduct a vigorous shareholder outreach program to share our approach to corporate governance and obtain your insights and feedback on matters of mutual interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, we contacted shareholders owning approximately 49% of our outstanding shares, resulting in substantive engagements with the holders of approximately 17% of our outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In these engagements, we discussed topics that included industry and business developments, corporate strategy, executive compensation, proxy access and other corporate governance issues, environmental and social issues, and proxy statement disclosures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The perspectives provided by our shareholders informed our decision making and helped to guide our actions in adopting a proxy access Bylaw that provides long-term shareholders with the right to nominate directors who will be included in our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have continued to enhance our disclosures in our proxy statement and 2016 Integrated Report based on feedback received through these engagements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Business
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are an integrated energy company engaged primarily in electric power production and retail distribution operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entergy owns and operates power plants with approximately 30,000 megawatts of electric generating capacity, including nearly 10,000 megawatts of nuclear power.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entergy delivers electricity to 2.9 million utility customers in Arkansas, Louisiana, Mississippi and Texas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entergy has annual revenues of approximately $10.8 billion and more than 13,000 employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016: A Pivotal Year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we delivered on our commitment to grow our core utility business and completed our plan to exit the merchant power business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Entergys commitment to grow the core utility business while managing risk led to strong operational results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While charges relating to our actions to exit the merchant power business led to an as-reported loss of $(3.26) per share, our operational earnings in 2016 were $7.11 per share, which included a more than 40% increase in earnings from our core utility, parent and other business, after adjusting for the impact of taxes and weather.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * Our strong operational results for the year are the outcome of disciplined execution on our strategy to grow the utility while managing risk, including an orderly wind-down of our Entergy Wholesale Commodities (EWC) business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * See Appendix A for the reconciliation of non-GAAP financial measures to GAAP results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To grow the utility, we made major investments in clean, efficient and reliable generation and needed transmission infrastructure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We completed our acquisition of the 1,980 MW Union Power Station in Arkansas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also are moving forward with plans for four new build generation plants within our footprint which together represent nearly 4,000 MW of highly efficient, low-emission capacity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we also placed more than $1 billion in transmission capital projects into service to connect new generation units, support economic development and enhance system reliability, efficiency and resiliency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We began the regulatory process to deploy advanced metering infrastructure technology (AMI).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We filed n four jurisdictions to implement AMI, and we expect to file in Texas in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also began several new pilot programs to gain valuable experience in how to optimize and operate the grid of the future, including installing chargers for electric vehicles (EVs) in each jurisdiction and at our corporate headquarters to gain experience with EV resource integration, developing plans for expanded operations and integration of our utility solar and battery storage facility in New Orleans, and installing smart thermostats in New Orleans to help low-income customers save on their electricity consumption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We reduced the risk in our business by completing our plan to exit the merchant power business and reposition Entergy as a pure utility holding company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 and early 2017, we reached agreements or otherwise committed to sell or shut down all of the remaining nuclear plants in our merchant portfolio.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With sustained low wholesale energy prices and increased operating costs, the merchant power business has weighed on our as-reported earnings and stock price in relation to our utility peers for several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exiting the merchant power business, while difficult, is a sound strategic decision that we believe is necessary in order for us to continue to deliver on our mission to create sustainable value for all of our stakeholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Best Practices
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do    What We Dont Do         Require a double trigger for severance payments or equity acceleration in the event of a change in control           No 280G tax gross up payments in the event of a change in control    Maintain a clawback policy that goes beyond Sarbanes-Oxley requirements       No tax gross up payments on any executive perquisites, other than relocation benefits available to all eligible employees    Cap the maximum payout at 200% of target under our Long-Term Performance Unit Program and under our Annual Incentive Plan for members of the Office of the Chief Executive       No option repricing or cash buy-outs for underwater options under our equity plans    Require minimum vesting periods for equity based awards       No agreements providing for severance payments to executive officers that exceed 2.99 times annual base salary  and  annual  incentive  awards  without shareholder approval    Target our long-term compensation mix to give more weight to performance units than to service-based restricted stock and stock options combined       No unusual or excessive perquisites    Settle 100% of long-term performance units in shares of Entergy stock       New officers are excluded from participation in the System Executive Retirement Plan    Require our Chief Executive Officer to own 6 times base salary in stock and our other executive officers to own 1 to 3 times base salary in stock       No grants of supplemental service credit to newly-hired officers under any of the Companys non-qualified retirement plans    Require executives to hold substantially all equity compensation received from the Company until stock ownership guidelines are met         Prohibit directors and officers from pledging or entering into hedging or other derivative transactions with respect to their Entergy shares       Mitigate undue risk taking in compensation programs         Subject executive officer equity grants to non-compete and non-solicitation covenants

sentences.text: Our Pay for Performance Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entergys executive compensation programs are based on a philosophy of pay for performance that is embodied in the design of our annual and long-term incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We target total direct compensation (TDC) for our executive officers at market median and place a substantial portion of that compensation at risk subject to achieving both short- term and long-term performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 85% of the annual target TDC of our Chief Executive Officer and, on average, approximately 71% of the annual target TDC of our other Named Executive Officers (in each case excluding non-qualified supplemental retirement income) is equity or performance-based compensation.

sentences.text: Annual Incentive Plan

sentences.text: Awards under our Annual Incentive Plan are tied to our financial performance through the funding mechanism for the plan, the Entergy Achievement Multiplier (EAM), which for 2016 was based in equal part on managements degree of success in achieving our operational earnings per

sentences.text: share (EPS) and operational operating cash flow (OCF).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining the targets to set for 2016, the Committee reviewed anticipated drivers for operational EPS and OCF for 2016 as set forth in the Companys financial plan and reflected in the Companys published earnings guidance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the plan, operational EPS was expected to decline from 2015 results due primarily to the significant impact on 2015 operational results of tax benefits and, to a lesser extent, favorable weather, which were not anticipated to recur in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the plan, operational OCF was also expected to decline slightly in 2016 from 2015 results, due primarily to the timing of recovery of certain fuel and purchased power costs in the utility business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After adjusting to eliminate the impact of weather and tax benefits, the 2016 plan targets required management to achieve strong growth in utility operational earnings and modest growth in EWC operational earnings, despite an expectation for further declines in wholesale energy and capacity prices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the resulting targets represented declines from 2015 operational results, the Committee concluded, based on a careful review of the overall plan, that the targets derived from the plan challenged management appropriately to deliver strong growth in the Companys core business while continuing to manage the significant risks at EWC and represented an appropriate balancing of the Companys business risks and opportunities for 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: v 2016 Annual Incentive Plan Payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After reviewing the 2016 financial results, the Personnel Committee, based on a recommendation of the Finance Committee, determined that management exceeded its operational EPS goal of $5.35 per share by $1.76, but fell short of its operational OCF goal of $3.180 billion by approximately $176 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This resulted in a calculated EAM of 133%, which determined the maximum funding level for the plan and the maximum award, as a percentage of target, that could be received by any of the executive officers, subject to downward adjustment based on individual performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering individual performance, the Personnel Committee approved a payout of 133% of target for the Chief Executive Officer and payouts ranging from 100% to 130% of target for the other Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long-Term Performance Unit Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance under our Long-Term Performance Unit Program is measured over a three-year period by assessing Entergys total shareholder return (TSR) in relation to the total shareholder return of the companies included in the Philadelphia Utility Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts are based solely on the Companys relative performance and are not subject to adjustment by the Personnel Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: v Long-Term Performance Unit Program Payout.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the three year performance period ending in 2016, the Companys total shareholder return was in the third quartile, resulting in a payout of 36% of target for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts were made in shares of Entergy stock which are required to be held by executives until they satisfy our executive stock ownership guidelines.

sentences.text: Proposal 1  Election of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is presenting 11 nominees for election as directors at our Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each nominee currently serves as a director of the Company and was elected by our shareholders at our 2016 annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director elected will serve until the next annual meeting and until his or her successor is duly elected and qualified.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director nominee has consented to being named in this Proxy Statement and to serve as a director if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If any nominee is unable to stand for election for any reason, the shares represented at our Annual Meeting by proxy may be voted for another candidate proposed by our Board or our Board may choose to reduce its size.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies cannot be voted for a greater number of directors than the 11 nominees identified in this Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you sign and properly submit your proxy card, but do not give instructions with respect to voting for directors, your shares will be voted for the 11 persons recommended by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominee Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board includes a diverse group of leaders in their respective fields, with the result that each of the following key qualifications is well represented on our Board:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Key Qualification    Why Its Important Leadership and Senior Management Experience    Directors who hold or have held significant leadership positions provide the Company with unique insights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These people generally possess extraordinary leadership qualities as well as the ability to identify and develop those qualities in others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Their experiences developing talent and solving problems in large, complex organizations prepare them well for the responsibilities of Board service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finance and Accounting    Accurate financial reporting and robust auditing are critical to our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We seek to have at least one director who qualifies as an audit committee financial expert, and we expect all of our directors to be literate in finance and financial reporting processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Government, Legal, Public Policy    Our businesses are heavily regulated and are directly affected by governmental actions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As such, we seek directors with experience in government, law and public policy to provide insight and understanding of effective strategies in these areas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management    Managing risk in a rapidly changing environment is critical to our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors should have a sound understanding of the most significant risks facing the Company and the experience and leadership to provide effective oversight of risk management processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Industry/Nuclear    Due to the complexity of our business, we believe it is important to have directors with experience in the utility industry or in nuclear power operations to enable the Board to provide effective oversight of our operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director is independent under the NYSE listing standards and our Corporate Governance Guidelines if the Board affirmatively determines that the director has no material relationship with us directly or as a partner, shareholder or officer of an organization that has a material relationship with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board of Directors considers all of the independence factors specified in the rules of the NYSE in making its determination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has reviewed information concerning each of its non-employee directors and has considered all relevant transactions, relationships and arrangements to determine compliance with the independence standards established by the NYSE.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has affirmatively determined that each of our non-employee directors is independent within the meaning of the rules of the NYSE and our Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Heightened Standards for Audit and Personnel Committee Members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to the general independence requirements of the NYSE, all members of the Audit and Personnel Committees must meet the heightened independence standards imposed by the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) and the NYSE applicable to members of such committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each member of the Audit and Personnel Committees meets these heightened independence standards and each member of the Personnel Committee also qualifies as an independent director for purposes of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, no director may serve as a member of the Audit Committee if that director serves on the audit committees of more than two other public companies unless the Board determines that such simultaneous service would not impair the ability of that director to serve effectively on the Audit Committee.

sentences.text: Identifying Director Candidates
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Recruitment Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Committee is charged with reviewing the composition of the Board and refreshing the Board as appropriate through the recommendations it makes to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is an ongoing process through which the Board has added 5 new directors since 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These directors have brought to the Board, among other things, deep finance and accounting experience, nuclear expertise and senior leadership experience in companies or industries undergoing transformational change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee has not established any minimum qualifications that must be met by director candidates or identified any set of specific qualities or skills that it believes our directors must possess.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committees policy regarding consideration of potential director nominees acknowledges that choosing a Board member involves a number of objective and subjective assessments, many of which are difficult to quantify or categorize.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the following are certain principles the Corporate Governance Committee follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee   Evaluates Board needs and screens and interviews candidates   Reviews qualifications and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Seeks to nominate candidates with superior credentials, sound business judgment and the highest ethical character.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Takes into account the candidates relevant experience with businesses or other organizations of comparable size to the Company and seeks to identify candidates whose experience will add to the collective experience of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Believes the Board should reflect a diversity of backgrounds and experiences in various areas, including age, gender, race, geography and specialized experience, and candidates are assessed to determine the extent to which they would contribute to that diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee also seeks to confirm that candidates are not disqualified from serving on the Board under applicable legal or regulatory requirements and evaluates each candidates independence, as that term is defined under applicable legal and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee annually evaluates the effectiveness of its policy and procedures for the evaluation of director candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee will consider candidates identified by current directors, management, third party search firms engaged by the committee, and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders who wish to recommend a candidate to the Corporate Governance Committee or submit nominees for election at an annual or special meeting should follow the procedures described on page 88.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Retirement Policy and Term Limits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To facilitate proactive Board succession planning and self-renewal, our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that a person may not be nominated for election or re-election to the Board if he or she has reached the age of 74 on or before January 1 of the year in which such person would be elected or re-elected, unless specifically recommended to serve beyond the age of 74 by the Corporate Governance Committee and approved by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does not have term limits for its directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, our Board addresses the suitability for continued service as a director upon the expiration of each directors term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mandatory Resignation Upon Change in Circumstances
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines provide that non-employee directors should offer their resignations when either their employment or the major responsibilities they held when they joined the Board change.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee then reviews the change in circumstances and makes a recommendation to the Board as to whether it is appropriate for the director to continue to serve on the Board and be nominated for re-election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Orientation and Continuing Education
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon joining the Board, new directors undergo a comprehensive orientation program that introduces them to the Company, including our business operations, strategy, key members of management and corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This program is considered a valuable part of the director onboarding process and is annually reviewed for effectiveness by the Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors also are encouraged to enroll in director education programs, and the Corporate Governance Committee annually reviews and reports on director participation in such programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is briefed regularly on industry and corporate governance developments affecting the Company, and, at its annual retreat, the Board has the opportunity to discuss some of the most critical strategic issues facing the Company with outside experts in the applicable fields.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To enhance the Boards understanding of some of the unique issues affecting our nuclear fleet, directors are regularly invited to visit our nuclear plant sites, where they tour the facilities and interact directly with the personnel responsible for our day-to-day nuclear operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These activities collectively help to ensure that the Board remains knowledgeable about the most important issues affecting our Company and its business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Operations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Company is led by Leo P. Denault, who has served as Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board since February 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is currently composed of Mr. Denault and 10 independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines require that when the roles of Chairman of the Board and the Chief Executive Officer are combined, the Board of Directors appoints from among its independent members a Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Select The Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Corporate Governance Committee considers feedback from our Board members and the Chairman and then makes a recommendation to the Boards independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this recommendation, the Lead Director is appointed by a majority of the independent members of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Director, subject to his or her annual election to the Board of Directors, serves for a term of three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Stuart L. Levenick was elected as the Companys Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lead Director Responsibilities: Under our Corporate Governance Guidelines and other governance policies, the Lead Director has the following responsibilities:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership  Independent Director Meetings   Calls meetings of the independent directors    Presides at executive sessions of the independent directors and all meetings of the Board at which the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer is not present   Serves as a member of the Executive Committee of the Board Chairman  Independent Director Liaison    Serves as a liaison with the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer when requested by the independent directors Stakeholder Communication    Serves as the point of contact for shareholders and others to communicate with the Board Board Agendas    Reviews and advises on Board meeting agendas and consults with the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer on the preparation of agendas Chair and CEO Feedback Evaluation      Provides feedback from the Board to the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer following each executive session of independent directors and, together with the Chair of the Personnel Committee, provides the Chairman and Chief Executive Officer with an annual performance review Director Recruitment    Assists with recruitment of director candidates and, along with the Chairman, may extend the invitation to a new potential director to join the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why Our Board Structure Is Appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Committee annually evaluates the Boards leadership structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe having a combined Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, independent chairs for each of our Board committees and an independent Lead Director provides the right form of leadership for our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This leadership structure is commonly utilized by other public companies, and we believe it has been an effective structure for us because it facilitates swift and effective decision making and helps to ensure that the Company speaks with one voice, while at the same time encouraging open and constructive dialogue among Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also believe the independent leadership provided by our independent Lead Director and the independent chairs of each of our Board committees, combined with the fact that all of the directors other than our Chairman and Chief Executive Officer are independent, assures that the Board will act in an independent manner and free of any undue or inappropriate influence by management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Boards Governance Role
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Our Board Oversees Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the Board of Directors provides effective oversight of the risks we face and our risk assessment and risk management processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board reviews the Companys processes for identifying and managing risks and communicating with the Board about those risks to help ensure that the processes are effective.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Like other companies, Entergy is subject to many diverse risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These include financial and accounting risks, market and credit risks, capital deployment risks, operational risks, compensation risks, liquidity risks, litigation risks, strategic risks, regulatory risks, reputation risks, natural-disaster risks and technology risks, among others.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Some critical risks having enterprise-wide significance, such as corporate strategy and capital budget, require the full Boards active oversight, but our Board committees also play a key role because they can devote more time to reviewing specific risks within their respective areas of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22       2017 Proxy Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE AT ENTERGY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with NYSE standards, our Audit Committee has the primary responsibility for overseeing risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To assist the Audit Committee in discharging its oversight responsibility, management provides the committee with regular reports on specific risk areas, including environmental compliance, corporate compliance, significant legal matters, the Companys insurance programs, market and credit risks and cybersecurity risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have identified cybersecurity as a key enterprise risk.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Audit Committee receives comprehensive periodic reports on cybersecurity risks and issues from management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other things, these reports have focused on recent cyber risk and cybersecurity developments, industry engagement activities, legislative and regulatory developments, cyber risk governance and oversight, cyber incident response plans and strategies, cybersecurity drills and exercises, assessments by third party experts, key cyber risk metrics and activities, and major projects and initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to these management briefings, the Board has received briefings from outside experts on cybersecurity risks and cyber risk oversight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our standing Board committees also regularly consider risks arising within their respective functional areas of responsibility, with broad operational risks reviewed by the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thus, under their respective committee charters, the Finance Committee evaluates risks associated with strategic decisions and major transactions; the Audit Committee reviews risks relating to the financial reporting process and the Companys internal controls; the Corporate Governance Committee considers risks relating to the Companys corporate governance and legislative and regulatory policy; the Personnel Committee considers risks relating to compensation, safety, employee matters and succession planning; and the Nuclear Committee considers risks relating to safety and other matters unique to our nuclear fleet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of these committees receives regular reports from management which assist it in its oversight of risk in its respective area of responsibility.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Succession Planning for the Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Personnel Committee, the Chief Executive Officer, and the Senior Vice President, Human Resources maintain an ongoing focus on executive development and succession planning to prepare the Company for future success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to preparing for Chief Executive Officer succession, the succession planning process includes all other senior management positions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A comprehensive review of executive talent, including, from time to time, assessments by an independent consulting firm, determines readiness to take on additional leadership roles and identifies developmental and coaching opportunities needed to prepare our executives for greater responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Chief Executive Officer makes a formal succession planning presentation to the Board annually.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our succession planning also includes appropriate contingencies for the unexpected retirement or incapacity of the Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our Board adopted a detailed plan to address emergency Chief Executive Officer and senior management succession in extraordinary circumstances.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our emergency CEO succession plan is intended to enable our Board and our Company to respond quickly and effectively to an unplanned and unexpected vacancy in the position of Chief Executive Officer, regardless of cause and regardless of the surrounding circumstances, so as to assure continuity of leadership and minimize any disruption to our business and operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How Our Board and Committees Evaluate Their Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Board and each of its committees conduct an evaluation of their respective performance and effectiveness.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process is overseen by the Corporate Governance Committee and is reviewed annually to determine whether it is well designed to maximize its effectiveness and to ensure that all appropriate feedback is being sought and obtained by the Corporate Governance Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the process followed in 2016, a comprehensive questionnaire was circulated to all independent members of the Board that asked the directors to assign ratings and comment on a wide
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: range of issues relating to Board effectiveness including: Board and Committee structure and composition; Board and Committee succession planning; meeting structure, process and agendas; the Board evaluation process; management support and Board and management interface issues; and overall Board effectiveness, including the effectiveness of the Personnel Committee in its oversight of executive compensation and review of senior executive performance.

sentences.text: The collective ratings and comments were then compiled (on an anonymous basis), summarized and presented to the Corporate Governance Committee and the full Board for discussion.

sentences.text: Our Commitment to Shareholder Engagement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We welcome the opportunity to engage with you, our shareholders, to share our perspective on and obtain your nsights and feedback on matters of mutual interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our commitment to understanding the interests and perspectives of our shareholders is a key component of our corporate governance strategy and compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We engage with shareholders throughout the year to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discuss our financial and operational performance,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Share our perspective on Company and industry developments,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Discuss and solicit feedback on our corporate governance practices, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Solicit feedback on our communications and disclosures to investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Engage
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We approach shareholder engagement as an integrated, year-round process involving senior management, our investor relations team and our corporate governance team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout the year, we meet with analysts and institutional investors to inform and share our perspective and to solicit their feedback on our performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This includes participation in investor conferences and other formal events and group and one-on-one meetings throughout the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also engage with governance representatives of our major shareholders, through conference calls that occur during and outside of the proxy season.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Members of our corporate governance, investor relations and executive compensation groups discuss, among other matters, company performance, executive compensation and emerging corporate governance practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During our 2016-17 off-season outreach effort, we contacted the holders of approximately 49% of our outstanding shares, resulting in substantive engagements with the holders of approximately 17% of our outstanding shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In these engagements, we discussed the following issues and topics of mutual interest, among others:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Industry and business developments;   Corporate strategy;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive compensation;   Corporate governance issues, including proxy access;   Environmental and social issues; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The investors we spoke with remain supportive of the leadership our Board and management are providing and the business strategies our management is pursuing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: They generally agreed with our view that our executive compensation programs are well designed to align pay with performance and had done so effectively over the past several years, despite significant challenges that have led to total shareholder return that, with the exception of 2014, has lagged the median total shareholder return of the Philadelphia Utility Index for a significant period of time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to this feedback, we received suggestions for enhancing our proxy statement disclosures, and we have sought to respond to those suggestions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The comments, questions and suggestions offered by our investors were shared with, and discussed by the full Board, and their perspectives will inform the Boards decision making in 2017 and beyond.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enhanced our Disclosure.

sentences.text: We added more charts and graphs to better explain our performance, compensation and corporate governance practices, expanded our disclosure about our Audit Committee and made other changes to simplify the presentation of information and make important information more accessible.

sentences.text: Our 2016 Advisory Say-On-Pay Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company conducts an annual advisory vote on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the votes are not binding, the Personnel Committee believes that an annual Say-on-Pay advisory vote offers shareholders the opportunity to express their views regarding the Companys executive compensation programs and the Personnel Committees decisions on executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 Annual Meeting of Shareholders, approximately 92% of the votes cast with respect to our Say-on-Pay proposal were voted in favor of the Companys Named Executive Officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given this high level of support for the Companys executive compensation programs and the feedback received through our annual shareholder outreach process, the Personnel Committee believes that the Companys shareholders are supportive of our executive compensation pay practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Personnel Committee did not make any changes to Entergys executive compensation programs in response to this advisory vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How You Can Communicate With Our Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe communication between the Board of Directors and the Companys shareholders and other interested parties is an important part of the corporate governance process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent members of the Board have adopted procedures on how to submit communications to our Lead Director or any individual director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Information on how to submit any such communication can be found in our Shareholder and Third Party Communications  with  the  Board  Policy  on  Entergys  website  at http://www.entergy.com/investor_relations/corporate_governance.aspx.

sentences.text: Key Corporate Governance Documents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines, Certificate of Incorporation, Bylaws and Board committee charters form he framework of our corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we have adopted a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for the members of our Board of Directors, a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics for our employees and a Code of Entegrity, which sets forth the ethical responsibilities of our employees, officers and representatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines, the charters of our Audit, Corporate Governance and Personnel Committees, and our Code of Entegrity and other ethics policies, including any amendments or waivers, are available at http://www.entergy.com/investor_relations/corporate_governance.aspx and in print to any shareholder who requests a copy from the Secretary of the Company.

sentences.text: The Board believes that implementation of proxy access provides long term shareholders with a valuable and important right to nominate directors to the Board.

sentences.text: Below is a summary of key details of our proxy access Bylaw:

sentences.text: Vote Required to Elect Directors Annually
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws require each director to be elected by a majority of the votes cast with respect to such director in uncontested elections (the number of shares voted For a director must exceed the number of votes cast Against that director).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a contested election (a situation in which the number of nominees exceeds the number of directors to be elected), the standard for election of directors will be a plurality of votes cast by holders of shares entitled to vote at any meeting for the election of directors at which a quorum is present.

sentences.text: Political Contributions and Lobbying Oversight and Disclosure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are committed to participating constructively in the political and legislative process, as we believe such participation is essential to our Companys long-term success.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy outlines our principles governing political and lobbying activities, including our policy prohibiting corporate contributions directly to federal, state or local candidates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the alignment of directors interests with those of shareholders is strengthened when Board members are also shareholders.

sentences.text: The Board also has adopted guidelines that require all non-employee directors, within five years of being first elected, to own shares or units of Entergy common stock having a market value of at least $475,000, or five times the annual cash retainer.

sentences.text: CD&A Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016: A Pivotal Year
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we delivered on our commitment to grow our core utility business and completed our plan to exit the merchant power business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Earnings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, Entergys commitment to grow the core utility business while managing risk led to strong growth in operational earnings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although charges relating to our actions to exit the merchant power business led to an as- reported loss of $(3.26) per share, our operational earnings for 2016 were $7.11 per share, compared to an as-reported loss of $(0.99) per share and operational earnings of $6.00 per share for 2015.* Our operational earnings substantially exceeded the $5.35 midpoint of the guidance range we set at the beginning of the year and reflected a more than 40% increase in earnings from our core utility, parent and other business, after adjusting for the impact of taxes and weather.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also in 2016, our Board approved an increase in the dividend for the second consecutive year, and our financial position remains strong.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These results are the outcome of disciplined execution on our strategy to grow the utility while managing risk and have positioned us well to deliver on the promise of the Integrated Energy Network of tomorrow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Growing the Utility: Portfolio Transformation and the Integrated Energy Network
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to transform our generation portfolio with investments in cleaner, more efficient generation to improve the reliability of our system, increase environmental efficiency and reduce costs for customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we completed the acquisition of the Union Power Station in Arkansas, and we are moving forward with plans for new build options at the St. Charles Power Station and the Lake Charles Power Station in Louisiana, the Montgomery County Power Station in Texas, and the New Orleans Power Station which represent, in the aggregate, nearly 4,000 MW of new generation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we also placed more than $1 billion in transmission capital projects into service to connect new generation units, support economic development and enhance system reliability, efficiency and resiliency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This ncluded upgraded 230 kV transmission lines from our Nine Mile generating facilities for Entergy Louisiana and Entergy New Orleans; three major projects completed by Entergy Texas to comply with NERC reliability standards and to reduce congestion in its service territory; and investments in substations and other projects across our service territory to serve new industrial customers and provide opportunities for growth and development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In December 2016, the Midcontinen ndependent System Operator (MISO) board approved all 48 of our proposed transmission projects, totaling approximately $480 million of new transmission investment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entergy is investing today to build the Integrated Energy Network of tomorrowa dynamic, interactive power system that will include both centralized generation and distributed energy sources, connected by an intelligent, resilient, multi-directional network.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This new network will enable enhanced products and services beyond basic power delivery that are environmentally friendly and give customers more control and greater reliability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A key step in the development of this new network is the deployment of an advanced metering infrastructure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We filed in four jurisdictions to implement advanced metering in 2016, and expect to file in Texas in 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advanced meters will enable operating efficiencies and faster outage response while providing customers with better information and control of their energy use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ahead of meter deployment, we are constructing and implementing back office systems, new distribution and outage systems and new communications infrastructure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: * See Appendix A for the reconciliation of non-GAAP financial measures to GAAP results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also have begun several pilot programs to gain valuable experience in how to optimize and operate the grid of the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These programs include installing chargers for electric vehicles in each jurisdiction and at our corporate headquarters to gain experience with EV resource integration, developing plans for expanded operations and integration of our utility solar and battery storage facility in New Orleans, and installing smart thermostats in New Orleans to help low-income customers save on their electricity consumption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As we work today to design and construct the right resource mix and distribution infrastructure for our customers, we continue to explore and evaluate new technologies for potentially broader deployment in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Exiting the Merchant Power Business
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With sustained low wholesale energy prices and increased operating costs, the merchant power business has weighed on our as-reported earnings and stock price in relation to our utility peers for several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because of the increasing costs and risks associated with this business, our stock has traded at a discount to the utility industry for several years and our as-reported earnings have suffered despite consistently strong operational results from our utility business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, charges resulting from our actions to exit the business led to an as reported loss of $(3.26) per share, and our total shareholder return of 12.5% placed us in the bottom quartile of our utility industry peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For these reasons, reducing the risk from the EWC business has been a strategic focus for us for several years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we completed our plan to exit the merchant power business by announcing the sale or closure of each of our remaining merchant nuclear assets and the sale of our wind assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our exit from this business began with our 2013 decision to shut down the Vermont Yankee nuclear plant at the end of 2014, followed by our decisions in 2015 to shut down our Pilgrim Nuclear Power Station and to sell the gas-fired Rhode Island State Energy Center.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 and early 2017, we completed our plan to exit the merchant power business:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: expect to close in the first half of 2017;   We reached an agreement to terminate the power purchase agreement that has been in place for the Palisades Nuclear Power Plant early, in 2018, and announced our decision to close the plant at that time; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We announced that our two nuclear generating units at the Indian Point Energy Center will shut down in 2020 and 2021.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also in 2016, we reached an agreement to transfer the decommissioning obligations for the closed Vermont Yankee Nuclear Power Station to a third party that specializes in decommissioning nuclear plants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With these steps, we are fundamentally repositioning Entergy as a pure play utility that will no longer carry the risk of the EWC business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe continued execution on this strategycombined with our continued commitment to achieving stable, predictable growth in earnings at the utilityhas the clear potential to return us to delivering top quartile total shareholder return for our shareholders again in the future.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Best Practices:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do    What We Dont Do         Require a double trigger for severance payments or equity acceleration in the event of a change in control           No 280G tax gross up payments in the event of a change in control    Maintain a clawback policy that goes beyond Sarbanes-Oxley requirements       No tax gross up payments on any executive perquisites, other than relocation benefits available to all eligible employees    Cap the maximum payout at 200% of target under our Long-Term Performance Unit Program and under our Annual Incentive Plan for members of the Office of the Chief Executive       No option repricing or cash buy-outs for underwater options under our equity plans    Require minimum vesting periods for equity based awards       No agreements providing for severance payments to executive officers that exceed 2.99 times annual base salary  and  annual  incentive  awards  without shareholder approval    Target our long-term compensation mix to give more weight to performance units than to service-based restricted stock and stock options combined       No unusual or excessive perquisites    Settle 100% of long-term performance units in shares of Entergy stock       New officers are excluded from participation in the System Executive Retirement Plan    Require our Chief Executive Officer to own 6 times base salary in stock and our other executive officers to own 1 to 3 times base salary in stock       No grants of supplemental service credit to newly-hired officers under any of the Companys non-qualified retirement plans    Require executives to hold substantially all equity compensation received from the Company until stock ownership guidelines are met         Prohibit directors and officers from pledging or entering into hedging or other derivative transactions with respect to their Entergy shares       Mitigate undue risk taking in compensation programs         Subject executive officer equity grants to non-compete and non-solicitation covenants

sentences.text: Our Pay for Performance Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Entergys executive compensation programs are based on a philosophy of pay for performance that is embodied in the design of our annual and long-term incentive plans.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the executive pay programs described in this section and in the accompanying tables have played a significant role in our ability to drive strong financial and operational results and to attract and retain a highly experienced and successful management team.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Annual Incentive Plan incentivizes and rewards the achievement of operational financial metrics that are deemed by the Personnel Committee to be consistent with the overall goals and strategic direction that the Board has approved for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our long-term incentive programs further align the interests of our executives and our shareholders by directly tying the value of the equity awards granted to executives under these programs to our stock price performance and total shareholder return.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By incentivizing officers to achieve important financial and operational objectives and create long-term shareholder value, these programs play a key role in creating sustainable value for the benefit of all of our stakeholders, including our shareholders, customers, employees and communities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At Risk Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our total direct compensation (TDC) consists of base salary, annual cash incentive and long-term compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We target TDC for our executive officers at market median and place a significant portion of that compensation at risk subject to achieving both short-term and long-term performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Approximately 85% of the annual target TDC of our Chief Executive Officer and, on average, approximately 71% of the annual target TDC of our other Named Executive Officers (in each case excluding non-qualified supplemental retirement income) is equity or performance-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only the base salary portion of executive compensation is fixed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To develop a competitive compensation program, the Personnel Committee annually reviews compensation data from two sources:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Competitive Data
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses published and private compensation survey data to develop marketplace compensation levels for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The data, which are compiled by Pay Governance LLC, the Committees independent compensation consultant, compare the current compensation opportunities provided to each of our executive officers against the compensation opportunities provided to executives holding similar positions at companies with corporate revenues similar to ours.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For non-industry specific positions, the Committee reviews general industry data for total cash compensation (base salary and annual incentive) since the market for talent is broader than the utility sector.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For management positions that are industry-specific, such as Group President, Utility Operations, the Committee reviews data from utility companies for total cash compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, for long-term incentives, all positions are reviewed relative to utility market data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The survey data reviewed by the Committee cover hundreds of companies across a broad range of industries and approximately 60 investor-owned utility companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating compensation levels against the survey data, the Committee considers only the aggregated survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The identities of the companies participating in the compensation survey data are not disclosed to, or considered by, the Committee in its decision-making process and, thus, are not considered material by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee uses this survey data to develop compensation opportunities that are designed to deliver total target compensation at approximately the 50th percentile of the surveyed companies in the aggregate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The survey data are the primary data used for purposes of assessing target compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, Mr. Denault, our Chief Executive Officer, is compensated at a higher level than our other Named Executive Officers, reflecting market practices that compensate chief executive officers at greater potential compensation levels with more pay at risk than other Named Executive Officers, due to the greater responsibilities and accountability required of a Chief Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In most cases, the Committee considers its objectives to have been met if our Chief Executive Officer and the eight (8) other executive officers (including all of the Named Executive Officers) who constitute what we refer to as our Office of the Chief Executive each has a target compensation opportunity that falls within the range of 85%  115% of the 50th percentile of the survey data.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Promoted officers or officers who are new to their roles may be transitioned into the targeted market range over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Actual compensation received by an individual officer may be above or below the targeted range based on an individual officers skills, performance, experience and responsibilities, Company performance and internal pay equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the total target compensation of each of our Named Executive Officers fell within the targeted range, except for one officer whose total targeted compensation was set slightly above the targeted range based on the Committees assessment of his skills, performance, experience and responsibilities and internal pay equity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the survey data described above are the primary data used in determining compensation, the Committee reviews data derived from the proxy statements of companies included in the Philadelphia Utility Index as an additional point of comparison.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our goal for our long-term incentive compensation is to focus our executive officers on building shareholder value and to increase our executive officers ownership of our common stock in order to more closely align their interest with those of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In our long-term incentive compensation programs, we use a mix of performance units, restricted stock and stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Performance units reward the Named Executive Officers on the basis of total shareholder return, which is a measure of stock price appreciation and dividend payments, in relation to the companies in the Philadelphia Utility Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Restricted stock ties our executive officers long-term financial interest to the long-term financial interests of our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options provide a direct incentive to increase the value of our common stock.

sentences.text: Performance Unit Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We issue performance unit awards to our Named Executive Officers under our Long-Term Performance Unit Program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each performance unit represents the value of one share of our common stock at the end of the three-year performance period, plus dividends accrued during the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Personnel Committee sets payout opportunities for the program at the outset of each performance period, and the program is structured to reward Named Executive Officers only if performance goals approved by the Personnel Committee are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Personnel Committee has no discretion to make awards if minimum performance goals are not achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The performance units granted under the Long-Term Performance Unit Program and accrued dividends on any shares earned during the performance period are settled in shares of Entergy common stock rather than cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No shares are issued, including shares attributable to accrued dividends, unless performance goals are achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All shares paid out under the Long-Term Performance Unit Program are required to be retained by our officers until applicable executive stock ownership requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Long-Term Performance Unit Program specifies a minimum, target and maximum achievement level, the achievement of which will determine the number of performance units that may be earned by each participant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We measure performance by assessing Entergys total shareholder return relative to the total shareholder return of the companies in the Philadelphia Utility Index, which we refer to as our peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Personnel Committee identified the Philadelphia Utility Index as the appropriate industry peer group for this purpose because the companies included in this index, in the aggregate, approximate the Company in terms of business and scale.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Personnel Committee chose relative total shareholder return as a measure of performance because it reflects the Companys creation of shareholder value relative to other electric utilities over the performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It also takes into account dividends paid by the companies in this index and normalizes certain events that affect the industry as a whole.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Minimum, target and maximum performance levels are determined by reference to the ranking of Entergys total shareholder return against the total shareholder return of the companies in the Philadelphia Utility Index.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
